entry.title: The Private Water Supplies (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Private Water Supplies Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2009 (“the Principal Regulations”) with the aim of further protecting human health from the adverse effects of any contamination of water supplied for human consumption purposes. In particular, they make further provision to implement Council Directive 2013/51/Euratom laying down requirements for the protection of the health of the general public with regard to radioactive substances in water intended for human consumption. The Principal Regulations are amended in the following ways.

entry.title: The National Health Service (Personal Medical Services Agreements) Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations consolidate provision previously contained in the National Health Service (Personal Medical Services Agreements) Regulations 2004 (S.I. 2004/627) as amended which are revoked by regulation 90 and Schedule 4. They set out, in relation to England, the framework for personal medical services contracts made by virtue of provision in section 92 of the National Health Service Act 2006 (“the Act”) (arrangements by the National Health Service Commissioning Board for the provision of primary medical services).

entry.title: The National Health Service (General Medical Services Contracts) Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations consolidate provisions previously contained in the National Health Service (General Medical Services Contracts) Regulations 2004 (S.I. 2004/291) (“the 2004 Regulations”), as amended, which are revoked by regulation 98 and Schedule 5. They set out, in relation to England, the framework for general medical services contracts made under section 84 (general medical services contracts: introductory) of the National Health Service Act 2006 (c.41) (“the Act”).

entry.title: The Bristol (Electoral Changes) Order 2015
entry.summary: This Order makes changes to electoral arrangements for the district of Bristol, which is a metropolitan district with city status, following recommendations made by the Local Government Boundary Commission for England. The area of the district remains unchanged. The electoral changes apply in respect of local government elections to be held on and after the ordinary day of election of councillors in 2016.

entry.title: The Civil Legal Aid (Scotland) (Miscellaneous Amendments) Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Civil Legal Aid (Scotland) (Fees) Regulations 1989 and the Civil Legal Aid (Scotland) Regulations 2002.

entry.title: The Cherwell (Electoral Changes) Order 2015
entry.summary: This Order makes changes to electoral arrangements for the district of Cherwell following recommendations made by the Local Government Boundary Commission for England. The area of the district remains unchanged. The electoral changes apply in respect of local government elections to be held on and after the ordinary day of election of councillors in 2016.

entry.title: The Scottish Tribunals (Eligibility for Appointment) Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations set eligibility criteria for appointments as legal members of the First-tier Tribunal for Scotland and Upper Tribunal for Scotland. They also provide eligibility criteria for appointment of ordinary members of the First-tier Tribunal. In the case of the ordinary members the criteria cover experience in tax matters (regulation 2) and experience in housing, property or surveying matters (regulation 3).

entry.title: The Warwickshire (Electoral Changes) Order 2015
entry.summary: This Order makes changes to electoral arrangements for the county of Warwickshire following recommendations made by the Local Government Boundary Commission for England. The area of the county remains unchanged. The electoral changes apply in respect of local government elections to be held on and after the ordinary day of election of councillors in 2017.

entry.title: The Natural Mineral Water, Spring Water and Bottled Drinking Water Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations implement and enforce the following European instruments—

entry.title: The Hertfordshire (Electoral Changes) Order 2015
entry.summary: This Order makes changes to electoral arrangements for the county of Hertfordshire following recommendations made by the Local Government Boundary Commission for England. The area of the county remains unchanged. The electoral changes apply in respect of local government elections to be held on and after the ordinary day of election of councillors in 2016.

entry.title: The Immigration (Exemption from Control) (Amendment) Order 2015
entry.summary: This Order amends the Immigration (Exemption from Control) Order 1972 (S.I 1972/1613) made under section 8(2) of the Immigration Act 1971 (c. 77) (“the 1971 Act”). The effect is to exempt eligible dependants of members of the United States visiting forces posted in the United Kingdom from any provision of the 1971 Act relating to those who are not British citizens (except any provision relating to deportation). This is subject to the dependant meeting the suitability criteria under Appendix Armed Forces of the Immigration Rules and providing evidence that the member is able to maintain and accommodate the dependant without recourse to public funds.

entry.title: The Financial Services and Markets Act 2000 (Relevant Authorised Persons) Order 2015

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Financial Services and Markets Act 2000 (Relevant Authorised Persons) Order 2015

entry.summary: This Order provides that authorised persons falling within either of two categories of non-UK institution are ‘relevant authorised persons’ for the purposes of Part 5 of the Financial Services and Markets Act 2000 (the “Act”) and for the purposes of the Financial Services (Banking Reform) Act 2013 (Transitional and Savings Provisions) Order 2015 (which contains transitional and savings provision in connection with the coming into force of the amendments to Part 5 of the Act made by the Financial Services (Banking Reform) Act 2013).

entry.title: The Family Procedure (Amendment No. 3) Rules 2015

ukm:Subject.Value: SENIOR COURTS OF ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: SENIOR COURTS OF ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: These Rules amend the Family Procedure Rules 2010 (S.I. 2010/2955) (“the FPR”).

entry.title: The Financial Services and Markets Act 2000 (Regulated Activities) (Amendment) (No. 3) Order 2015

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Financial Services and Markets Act 2000 (Regulated Activities) (Amendment) (No. 3) Order 2015

entry.summary: This Order amends the Financial Services and Markets Act 2000 (Regulated Activities) Order 2001 (S.I. 2001/544) (“the Regulated Activities Order”). The amendments made by this Order supplement amendments to the Regulated Activities Order made by the Mortgage Credit Directive Order 2015 (S.I. 2015/910), which transposed in part Directive 2014/17/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 4th February 2014 on credit agreements for consumers relating to residential immovable property and amending Directives 2008/48/EC and 2013/36/EU and Regulation (EU) No 1093/2010 (“the mortgages directive”) (OJ L 60, 28.2.2014, p.34). The Financial Conduct Authority (“FCA”) has transposed other parts of the mortgages directive in rules. A transposition note setting out how the mortgages directive has been transposed into UK law is available from Her Majesty’s Treasury, 1 Horse Guards Road, London SW1A 2HQ or on HM Treasury’s website (www.gov.uk/government/organisations/hm-treasury).

entry.title: The Financial Services and Markets Act 2000 (Misconduct and Appropriate Regulator) Order 2015

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Financial Services and Markets Act 2000 (Misconduct and Appropriate Regulator) Order 2015

entry.summary: This Order amends the Financial Services and Markets Act 2000 (c.8) (“the 2000 Act”) to confer additional disciplinary powers on the Financial Conduct Authority (the “FCA”) and the Prudential Regulation Authority (the “PRA”).

entry.title: The Courts Reform (Scotland) Act 2014 (Commencement No. 5, Transitional and Saving Provisions) Order 2015
entry.summary: This Order brings into force provisions of the Courts Reform (Scotland) Act 2014 (“the Act”). The provisions specified in column 1 of the table in the Schedule to the Order come into force on 1st January 2016. The subject matter of these provisions is set out in column 2 of the table, and where provisions are brought into force only for a limited purpose, this purpose is given in column 3.

entry.title: The Sheriff Appeal Court Fees Order 2015
entry.summary: This Order makes provision for the fees payable in the Sheriff Appeal Court, to the Clerk of the Sheriff Appeal Court or any officer acting for the Clerk.

title.div: The Natural Mineral Water, Spring Water and Bottled Drinking Water (Wales) Regulations 2015 / Rheoliadau Dŵr Mwynol Naturiol, Dŵr Ffynnon a Dŵr Yfed wedi’i Botelu (Cymru) 2015

div.p: These Regulations, which apply in Wales, implement and enforce the following European instruments—
Mae’r Rheoliadau hyn, sy’n gymwys yng Nghymru, yn gweithredu ac yn gorfodi’r offerynnau Ewropeaidd a ganlyn—

entry.title: The Colchester (Electoral Changes) Order 2015
entry.summary: This Order makes changes to electoral arrangements for the district of Colchester, which is a non-metropolitan district with borough status, following recommendations made by the Local Government Boundary Commission for England. The area of the district remains unchanged. The electoral changes apply in respect of local government elections to be held on and after the ordinary day of election of councillors in 2016.

entry.title: The Housing Benefit (Abolition of the Family Premium and date of claim) (Amendment) Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Housing Benefit Regulations 2006 (S.I. 2006/213) and the Housing Benefit (Persons who have attained the qualifying age for state pension credit) Regulations 2006 (S.I. 2006/214).
